fields.name: Mojito
fields.ingredients: 10 fresh mint leaves, 1 cup ice cubes, 1/2 lime cut into 4 wedges, 1 1/2 fluid ounces white rum, 2 tablespoons white sugar or to taste 1/2 cup club soda
fields.recipe: Place mint leaves and 1 lime wedge into a sturdy glass. Use a muddler to crush the mint and lime to release the mint oils and lime juice. Add 2 more lime wedges and the sugar, and muddle again to release the lime juice. Do not strain the mixture. Fill the glass almost to the top with ice. Pour the rum over the ice, and fill the glass with carbonated water. Stir, taste, and add more sugar if desired. Garnish with the remaining lime wedge.
fields.description: A classic cocktail originating from cuba. Lets you feel the cold breeze on a warm summer evening. Mojito will tingle your tongue with its sugary taste, enliven you with its gentle touch of alcohol and cool you off with its minty aftertaste.

fields.name: Sex On The Beach
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces vodka, 3/4 ounce ​peach schnapps, 1/2 ounce ​creme de cassis (or ​Chambord), 2 ounces ​orange juice (or ​pineapple juice), 2 ounces ​cranberry juice, Orange slice, maraschino cherry for garnish,
fields.recipe: Pour all the ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass. Garnish with the orange slice and maraschino cherry.
fields.description: ADVENTURE! Everyone loves hearing that word... The provocative name is just a facade for the innocence of this fruity cocktail. If you are looking to make your night epic, Sex on the beach is the cocktail to start.

fields.name: Long Island Iced Tea
fields.ingredients: 1/2 ounce triple sec, 1/2 ounce light rum, 1/2 ounce gin, 1/2 ounce vodka, 1/2 ounce tequila, 1-ounce sour mix, 7 ounces Cola (or enough to top off a Collins glass), Garnish: lemon wedge
fields.recipe: Pour the spirits and sour mix into a collins glass with ice. Stir well. Top the glass off with cola. Garnish with a lemon wedge.
fields.description: Another killer cocktail for the hot summer nights! 4 spirits join together to make your experience amazing! And we hope memorable... haha. Despite the large amounts of alcohol in this cocktail it still feels smooth and easy to pour down your throat.

fields.name: Bloody Mary
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces vodka, 3 ounces tomato juice, 1/2 ounce lemon juice, 1 dash of Worcestershire sauce, Pinch celery salt, Pinch ground pepper, Hot sauce to taste, Horseradish to taste (optional), Celery stalk and/or pickle spear for garnish, Lemon wedge for garnish
fields.recipe: Build the liquid ingredients in a highball glass over ice cubes. Stir well. If you feel like doing a fun mixing technique, try rolling this one. Adjust the seasonings to taste. Garnish with a lemon and celery or pickle.
fields.description: Mixing vodka and chilli to make a cocktail? Whoever though of that was crazy... and genius! A lot of people are not huge fans of this bad boy(or lady) but it has endless variations, at least one of wich will suit your taste. Don't be afraid to try something new! This is how out most amazing nights happen!

fields.name: Cuba Libre
fields.ingredients: 2 ounces light rum, Juice of 1/2 a lime, 2 ounces cola
fields.recipe: Squeeze the juice of half a lime into a collins glass. Add ice cubes. Pour the rum and cola into the glass. Stir well.
fields.description: Can you feel it? The taste of freedom... the energy this drink moves through your body is insane! It wakes you up and gets you moving like nothing else! A mix of Baradi rum and cola is something you can trust will set you free. CUBA LIBRE!

fields.name: Daiquiri
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces light rum, 3/4 ounce fresh lime juice, 1/4 ounce simple syrup
fields.recipe: Pour the light rum, lime juice and sugar syrup into a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.
fields.description: An exotic name indeed. Strawberry Daiquiri, Banana Daiquiri, Hemingway Daiquiri etc. There are a lot of them! The classic Daiquiri is a super simple rum cocktail that’s well-balanced and refreshing. The combination of sweet, sour and spirit is refreshingly tangy and perfect for any occasion.

fields.name: Jägerbomb
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces Jägermeister, 1/2 can Red Bull Energy Drink
fields.recipe: Fill a shot glass with Jägermeister. Fill a highball glass, or other tall glass, with Red Bull. Drop the shot glass into the taller glass and drink immediately.
fields.description: Very popular at the bar, you will often see groups of people drinking Jäger Bombs together. You will either love them or hate them, there is not much middle ground with this potent shot. Without a doubt, this is a drink every bartender should know.

fields.name: Rainbow shots
fields.ingredients: 6oz Pineapple juice, 1/2oz grenadine, 1oz vodka, 3/4oz blue curaçao, crushed ice
fields.recipe: Measure out 1/2oz. of grenadine and carefully pour it into the bottom of the shaker, being careful not to get it on the sides. Gently add crushed ice to the shaker until it is 3/4 full. Place a big spoon over the ice and slowly pour 6oz. of pineapple juice into the shaker. Leave the big spoon resting atop the ice and pour 1oz. of vodka slowly onto the spoon. Slowly add 3/4oz. blue curaçao to the tip of the spoon only. Start pouring the shots right away from the side of the shaker your added the blue curaçao to.
fields.description: These are one of the best party shots ever. There's nothing like a good magic show and Rainbow Shots definitely deliver - when you pour many different colored shots out of the same shaker right in front of your guests eyes?!! A perfect presto.

fields.name: Shark Attack Shot
fields.ingredients: 1 oz Tequila, Splash Blue Curacao, 1/2 oz Grenadine, 1/2 oz UV Cherry,
fields.recipe: Pour the Grenadine and the UV Cherry in a shot. Here is the tricky part, put another glass over the shot, holding the shot pressed to the bottom of that glass, then turn the two upside down, trying not to spill anything and leave the glass on a table.Put the rest of the ingredients in a different glass and stir them.Pour them in the glass with the shot upside down.
fields.description: Start your night right with an amazing Shark Attack Shot! After the fluids in the two cups mix you will see why this in the name of this shot. Your guests will definitely be impressed!

fields.name: Blowjob shot
fields.ingredients: 1/4 ounce Baileys Irish cream liqueur, 1/2 ounce amaretto almond liqueur, Garnish: ​whipped cream
fields.recipe: Fill about a 1/3 of a shot glass with Amaretto almond liqueur. With the help of a teaspoon, carefully pour the baileys over the liqueur, so they dont mix - You might need several tries before doing it right. Garnish with wipped cream.
fields.description: The Blow Job is a creamy mix of amaretto and Irish cream topped with whipped cream and it is one of the tastiest shots you can mix up. It is also very easy and both liqueurs are inexpensive, so this is a great option for parties.

fields.name: Nuclear Reactor Shot
fields.ingredients: 1 oz Midori, 1 oz Sweet & Sour, 1/2 oz Everclear, 1 oz Sprite, Splash UV Blue Vodka, Splash Island Pucker
fields.recipe: Pour the Midori, Sweet & Sour and Everclear in a shaker filled with ice and shake it. Pour the mix in a shot. Here is the tricky part, put another glass over the shot, holding the shot pressed to the bottom of that glass, then turn the two upside down, trying not to spill anything and leave the glass on a table. Pour the rest of the ingredients in the glass with a shot in it.
fields.description: What?!? Yes you read right. Nuclear. Reactor. Shot. This baby will have your friends jumping around in ecstasy. Its a little bit expensive on liquor but its definately a party special!

fields.name: Blue Kamikaze
fields.ingredients: 1 Part Vodka, 1 Part Blue Curacao, 1 Part Lime Juice
fields.recipe: In an ice filled shaking glass combine vodka, blue curaçao and lime juice. Shake well. Strain mix into shot glasses. Enjoy responsibly!
fields.description: These colorful, slightly fruity kamikaze shots might look (and taste) sweet, but don't let that fool you. They are easy to make and fun to drink with your friends at a party! A definite recommendation!

fields.name: Dutch Mojito
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 oz Jenever Gin, 1 oz Simple Syrup, 8 Mint Leaves, Barspoon Brown Sugar, Sparkling Water, Garnish: Mint Sprig
fields.recipe: To base of glass add lime wedges, mint leaves and brown sugar. Muddle. Add ice to glass and pour over jenever gin and simps syrup. Stir lightly. Top with sparkling water and garnish with a mint sprig. Enjoy responsibly!
fields.description: A classic cocktail originating from cuba. Lets you feel the cold breeze on a warm summer evening. Mojito will tingle your tongue with its sugary taste, enliven you with its gentle touch of alcohol and cool you off with its minty aftertaste.

fields.name: Irish Coffee
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 oz Parts Irish Whiskey, 3 oz Parts Hot Coffee, 1 oz Heavy Cream (Slightly Whipped), 1 Tsp Brown Sugar
fields.recipe: Pour hot water into serving glass to heat. Toss hot water, pour in coffee and stir in sugar until dissolved. Add whiskey, stir to combine and float cream on top. Enjoy responsibly!
fields.description: Regrettably, perhaps, we've gotten away from the breakfast/brunch cocktail. If anyone tells you that Irish Coffee is a sweet drink, scald them with your coffee. You only need a little sugar, your Irish, your coffee, and a dollop of lightly whipped cream atop.

fields.name: Blue Hawaiian
fields.ingredients: 1 1/2 ounces ​rum, 3/4 ounce blue curaçao, 3/4 ounce ​creme de coconut, 2 ounces ​pineapple juice, Garnish: maraschino cherry, Garnish: pineapple wedge
fields.recipe: Pour the ingredients into a mixing glass filled with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into a collins glass filled with ice cubes. Garnish with the cherry and pineapple.
fields.description: Invented in Hawaii in the 1950s, the Blue Hawaiian will have you crooning like Elvis. The Blue Hawaiian is a fantastic and fun tiki drink. It's filled with rum, pineapple, and coconut and, best of all, it's blue!

fields.name: Bora Bora
fields.ingredients: 1/2 parts Grenadine, 1/4 parts Lime juice, 3 parts Pineapple juice, 3 parts Ginger ale
fields.recipe: Fill up a glass with ice. Fill up a shaker with ice. Pour ginger ale, pineapple juice, lime juice and grenadine into the shaker. Shake well. Strain into the glass. Garnish with cocktail cherry and lime wheel.

fields.name: Galaxy
fields.ingredients: 1 oz Tequila, 3/4 oz Blue Curacao, 3/4 oz Grenadine, 2 oz Lemonade, 1/2 oz Vodka, 3/4 oz Triple Sec, 3/4 oz Blue Curacao, Ice
fields.recipe: Blend the ice in a blender - Then put it in a glass. In a cup pour tequila, blue curaçao, grenadine and Lemonade. In a different cup pour blue curaçao, grenadine, triple sec and Lemonade.  Stir both cups. In the glass with ice, fill the cup 1/3 with the first mix, then 1/3 with the second and the last 1/3 with the first again.

fields.name: Woo Woo
fields.ingredients: 1 ounce vodka, 1 ounce peach schnapps, 2 ounces cranberry, juice Garnish: ​lime wedge
fields.recipe: Place the ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass or into a highball filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a lime wedge.
